article.title: Breidablik
article.paragraph: InNorse mythology,BreiablikThe name can be Anglicized asBreidablik,BreithablikorBreidhablik.(Broad-gleaming) is the home ofBaldr. It is briefly described inSnorri Sturluson'sGylfaginningas one of the halls of Asgard:

list.listitem: "Then there is also in that place the abode called Breidablik, and there is not in heaven a fairer dwelling."GylfaginningXVII, Brodeur's translation.

article.paragraph: Later in the work, when Snorri describes Baldr, he gives a longer description, citingGrmnisml, though he does not name the poem:

list.listitem: "He dwells in the place called Breidablik, which is in heaven; in that place may nothing unclean be, even as is said here:
Breidablik 't is called, | where Baldr hasA hall made for himself:
In that land | where I know lieFewest banefulrunes."GylfaginningXXII, Brodeur's translation. The strophe isGrmnisml12.

article.paragraph: Breiablik is not otherwise mentioned in the Eddic sources.
article.heading: See also

list.listitem: Breidablik Peak, a mountain named after Breidablik.
